timeline.bodyText: Fail fast in CI. CI will end after 1 test failure.
timeline.author: aweng98

timeline.bodyText:
Address tslint error. == is intentional.
ERROR: 18:29  triple-equals  == should be ===
timeline.author: aweng98

replies.bodyText:
Why is == intentional here? Is getPropValue not returning an actual boolean? If not, I'd expect you could do
wantDisabled == Boolean(await getPropValue<boolean>(downloadBtn, 'disabled'))
replies.author: gjuggler

replies.bodyText:
== was intentional by CH. Link to that PR comment is here
The simplest way to address the tslint error is to disable the check here.
replies.author: aweng98

replies.bodyText:
nit: would prefer coercing to boolean over bypassing the linter here, e.g. as I outlined in my comment:

If you want to switch this to ===, please also make it !!(await getPropValue(downloadBtn, 'disabled')); Unless you're 100% confident that your helper method properly handles this case.

Also, we should put the lint check into CircleCI, otherwise you'll be the only person that notices..
replies.author: calbach

replies.bodyText: Also, I can send that change for the !!
replies.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: notebook image updated. Fix broken xpath selector.
timeline.author: aweng98

replies.bodyText: Sorry - thought I'd run puppeteer locally to check for this kind of issue, but it's possible it was failing for other reasons at the time, I can't remember now.
replies.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: Server should be able to handle more concurrent tests. Test playback time is faster.
timeline.author: aweng98
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -6,11 +6,11 @@
   "private": true,
   "license": "BSD",
   "scripts": {
-    "test": "cross-env jest --maxWorkers=3",
+    "test": "cross-env jest --maxWorkers=5",
     "test:debugTest": "cross-env PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true node --inspect-brk node_modules/.bin/jest",
     "test:debug": "cross-env PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true jest --detectOpenHandles",
-    "test-local": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=local DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=2",
-    "test-local:debug": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=local PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=2",
+    "test-local": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=local DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=3",
+    "test-local:debug": "cross-env WORKBENCH_ENV=local PUPPETEER_HEADLESS=false DEBUG=true jest --maxWorkers=3",

timeline.bodyText: Replace all non-letter characters with hyphen.
timeline.author: aweng98

timeline.bodyText: Case test_fn_failure were not working in some cases of failures such as unhandled exceptions, thus no screenshot were taken on failure. Change to case test_done and event.test.errors.length > 0 to cover all types of failures
timeline.author: aweng98

timeline.bodyText: Should we be doing something here if elementHandle does not exist? It seems like we leave the potential for err to be swallowed by this catch block. That's usually an anti-pattern, but I can't tell from the context whether that's desired behavior here. If it is, it's worth a comment.
timeline.author: gjuggler

replies.author: aweng98

timeline.bodyText: What is the impact of this change? It's a surprising enough value I would want to see a comment describing why it's appropriate. Even better if this were in a separate PR, unless it's related to the refactors in other files here.
timeline.author: gjuggler
gjuggler

timeline.bodyText: nit: this comment seems out of place, especially after the refactor. Maybe remove it?
timeline.author: gjuggler
